All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; which among them hath declared these things? The Lord hath loved him: he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall be on the Chaldeans. (Isaiah 48:14.) All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; who among them hath declared these things unto them? The Lord hath loved him; yea, and he will fulfill his word which he hath declared by them; and he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall come upon the Chaldeans. (1 Ne. 20:14.)

The Book of Mormon retention "unto them" identifies Israel, whom the Lord loved. This shows that the referent of "him" is not Cyrus, as many scholars say. "Babylon" and "the Chaldeans" appear to represent the Gentiles rather than those countries specifically.
